member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Search.IDocumentOperations.GetAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a document from the Azure Search index.
member.param: The key of the document to retrieve; See for the rules for constructing valid document keys.
List of field names to retrieve for the document; Any field not retrieved will be missing from the returned document.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Response containing the document.
member.remarks:
The non-generic overloads of the Get and GetAsync methods make a best-effort attempt to map JSON types in the response payload to .NET types. This mapping does not have the benefit of precise type information from the index, so the mapping is not always correct. In particular, be aware of the following cases:
Any numeric value without a decimal point will be deserialized to System.Int64 (long in C#).
Special double-precision floating point values such as NaN and Infinity will be deserialized as type System.String rather than System.Double.
Any string field with a value formatted like a DateTimeOffset will be deserialized incorrectly. We recommend storing such values in Edm.DateTimeOffset fields rather than Edm.String fields.
Any Edm.DateTimeOffset field will be deserialized as a System.DateTimeOffset, not System.DateTime.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Search.IDocumentOperations.GetAsync``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Retrieves a document from the Azure Search index.
member.typeparam: The CLR type that maps to the index schema. Instances of this type can be retrieved as documents from the index.
member.param: The key of the document to retrieve; See for the rules for constructing valid document keys.
List of field names to retrieve for the document; Any field not retrieved will have null or default as its corresponding property value in the returned object.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Response containing the document.
member.remarks:
The generic overloads of the Get and GetAsync methods support mapping of Azure Search field types to .NET types via the type parameter T. Note that most Azure Search field types are nullable, so for primitives they often map to nullable types. The type mapping is as follows:
Azure Search field type .NET type
Edm.String System.String (string in C#)
Collection(Edm.String) IEnumerable<System.String>
Edm.Boolean System.Nullable<System.Boolean> (bool? in C#)
Edm.Double System.Nullable<System.Double> (double? in C#)
Edm.Int32 System.Nullable<System.Int32> (int? in C#)
Edm.Int64 System.Nullable<System.Int64> (long? in C#)
Edm.DateTimeOffset
System.Nullable<System.DateTimeOffset> (DateTimeOffset? in C#) or System.Nullable<System.DateTime> (DateTime? in C#). Both types work, although we recommend using DateTimeOffset. When retrieving documents, DateTime values will always be in UTC. When indexing documents, DateTime values are interpreted as follows:
UTC DateTime Sent as-is to the index.
Local DateTime Converted to UTC before being sent to the index.
DateTime with unspecified time zone Assumed to be UTC and sent as-is to the index.
Edm.GeographyPoint Microsoft.Spatial.GeographyPoint

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Search.IDocumentOperations.IndexAsync(Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexBatch,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a batch of upload, merge, and/or delete actions to the Azure Search index.
member.param: The batch of index actions.
Cancellation token.
member.exception: Thrown when some of the indexing actions failed, but other actions succeeded and modified the state of the index. This can happen when the Search Service is under heavy indexing load. It is important to explicitly catch this exception and check its IndexResponse property. This property reports the status of each indexing action in the batch, making it possible to determine the state of the index after a partial failure.
member.returns: Response containing the status of operations for all actions in the batch.

Cancellation token.
member.exception: Thrown when some of the indexing actions failed, but other actions succeeded and modified the state of the index. This can happen when the Search Service is under heavy indexing load. It is important to explicitly catch this exception and check its IndexResponse property. This property reports the status of each indexing action in the batch, making it possible to determine the state of the index after a partial failure.

member.remarks:
The generic overloads of the Index and IndexAsync methods support mapping of Azure Search field types to .NET types via the type parameter T. See

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Search.DocumentOperationsExtensions.Index(Microsoft.Azure.Search.IDocumentOperations,Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.IndexBatch)
member.summary: Sends a batch of upload, merge, and/or delete actions to the Azure Search index.
member.param: Reference to the Microsoft.Azure.Search.IDocumentOperations.
The batch of index actions.
member.exception: Thrown when some of the indexing actions failed, but other actions succeeded and modified the state of the index. This can happen when the Search Service is under heavy indexing load. It is important to explicitly catch this exception and check its IndexResponse property. This property reports the status of each indexing action in the batch, making it possible to determine the state of the index after a partial failure.
member.returns: Response containing the status of operations for all actions in the batch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.DocumentSearchResponseBase`2.ContinuationToken
member.summary: Gets a continuation token that can be used to fetch the next page of search results from an Azure Search index.
member.remarks: This property will be null unless you request more than 1000 results, and the number of results exceeds 1000. In that case, you can pass the value of this property to the ContinueSearchAsync method to retrieve the next page of results.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchParameters class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.Facets
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of facet expressions to apply to the search query. Each facet expression contains a field name, optionally followed by a comma-separated list of name:value pairs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.Filter
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the OData $filter expression to apply to the search query. (see https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn798921.aspx for more information)

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.HighlightFields
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of field names to use for hit highlights. Only searchable fields can be used for hit highlighting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.HighlightPostTag
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a string tag that is appended to hit highlights. Must be set with HighlightPreTag. Default is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.HighlightPreTag
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a string tag that is prepended to hit highlights. Must be set with HighlightPostTag. Default is <em>.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.IncludeTotalResultCount
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to fetch the total count of results. Default is false. Setting this value to true may have a performance impact. Note that the count returned is an approximation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.MinimumCoverage
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a search query in order for the query to be reported as a success. This parameter can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica. The default is 100.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.OrderBy
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of OData $orderby expressions by which to sort the results. Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the geo.distance() function. Each expression can be followed by asc to indicate ascending, and desc to indicate descending. The default is ascending order. Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents. If no OrderBy is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score. There can be at most 32 Orderby clauses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.ScoringParameters
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of parameter values to be used in scoring functions (for example, referencePointParameter) using the format name:value. For example, if the scoring profile defines a function with a parameter called 'mylocation' the parameter string would be "mylocation:-122.2,44.8"(without the quotes).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.ScoringProfile
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the name of a scoring profile to evaluate match scores for matching documents in order to sort the results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.SearchFields
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of field names to include in the full-text search.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.SearchMode
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a value that specifies whether any or all of the search terms must be matched in order to count the document as a match.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.Select
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of fields to retrieve. If unspecified, all fields marked as retrievable in the schema are included.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.Skip
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the number of search results to skip. This value cannot be greater than 100,000. If you need to scan documents in sequence, but cannot use Skip due to this limitation, consider using OrderBy on a totally-ordered key and Filter with a range query instead.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SearchParameters.Top
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the number of search results to retrieve. This defaults to 50. If you specify a value greater than 1000 for Top and there are more than 1000 results, only the first 1000 results will be returned, along with a continuation token. See DocumentSearchResponse.ContinuationToken for more information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.MinimumCoverage
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a suggestion query in order for the query to be reported as a success. This parameter can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica. The default is 80.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.OrderBy
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of OData $orderby expressions by which to sort the results. Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the geo.distance() function. Each expression can be followed by asc to indicate ascending, and desc to indicate descending. The default is ascending order. Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents. If no OrderBy is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score. There can be at most 32 Orderby clauses.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.SearchFields
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of field names to consider when querying for suggestions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.Select
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the list of fields to retrieve. If unspecified, all fields marked as retrievable in the schema are included.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.Top
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the number of suggestions to retrieve. This must be a value between 1 and 100. The default is to 5.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Search.Models.SuggestParameters.UseFuzzyMatching
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use fuzzy matching for the suggestion query. Default is false. when set to true, the query will find suggestions even if there's a substituted or missing character in the search text. While this provides a better experience in some scenarios it comes at a performance cost as fuzzy suggestion searches are slower and consume more resources.
